   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of events sent as a consequence of diameter:subscribe/1.
   23: %% Watchdog events are dealt with more extensively in the watchdog
   24: %% suite.
   25: %%
   26: 
   27: -module(diameter_event_SUITE).
   28: 
   29: %% testcase, no common_test dependency
   30: -export([run/0]).
   31: 
   32: %% common_test wrapping
   33: -export([suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          traffic/1,
   36:          flooding/1]).
   37: 
   38: %% internal
   39: -export([up/1,
   40:          down/1,
   41:          cea_timeout/1]).
   42: 
   43: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   44: 
   45: 
   46: %% ===========================================================================
   47: 
   48: -define(util, diameter_util).
   49: 
   50: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   51: -define(REALM, "REALM").
   52: 
   53: -define(SERVER, "SERVER.SERVER-REALM").
   54: -define(CLIENT, "CLIENT.CLIENT-REALM").
   55: 
   56: -define(DICT_COMMON, ?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON).
   57: -define(DICT_ACCT,   ?DIAMETER_DICT_ACCOUNTING).
   58: 
   59: -define(SERVER_CAPX_TMO, 6000).
   60: 
   61: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   62: -define(SERVICE(Host, Dicts),
   63:         [{'Origin-Host', Host},
   64:          {'Origin-Realm', realm(Host)},
   65:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   66:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   67:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   68:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [D:id() || D <- Dicts]},
   69:          {decode_format, map}
   70:          | [{application, [{dictionary, D},
   71:                            {module, #diameter_callback{}}]}
   72:             || D <- Dicts]]).
   73: 
   74: %% Diameter Result-Code's:
   75: -define(NO_COMMON_APP, 5010).
   76: 
   77: -define(P(F), ?P(F, [])).
   78: -define(P(F, A),
   79:         io:format("~s "
   80:                   "~p(~w) " ++ F ++ "~n",
   81:                   [diameter_lib:formated_timestamp(),
   82:                    ?FUNCTION_NAME, ?LINE | A])).
   83: 
   84:                
   85: %% ===========================================================================
   86: 
   87: suite() ->
   88:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 180}}].
   89: 
   90: all() ->
   91:     [traffic, flooding].
   92: 
   93: traffic(_Config) ->
   94:     run().
   95: 
   96: %% Start one event collector process,
   97: %% then start 
   98: flooding(_Config) ->
   99:     ok = diameter:start(),
  100:     try
  101:         ?util:run([{fun flooding/0, 120000}])
  102:     after
  103:         ok = diameter:stop()
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: 
  107: flooding() ->
  108:     Services  =
  109:         [#{type         => server,
  110:            name         => ?SERVER,
  111:            service_opts => ?SERVICE(?SERVER, [?DICT_COMMON]),
  112:            transport    => #{prot      => tcp,
  113:                              operation => listen,
  114:                              opts      => [{capabilities_cb, fun capx_cb/2},
  115:                                            {capx_timeout, ?SERVER_CAPX_TMO}]}},
  116:          #{type         => client,
  117:            name         => ?CLIENT,
  118:            service_opts => ?SERVICE(?CLIENT, [?DICT_COMMON, ?DICT_ACCT]),
  119:            transport    => #{prot      => tcp,
  120:                              operation => connect,
  121:                              opts      => [{strict_mbit,    false},
  122:                                            {connect_timer,  5000},
  123:                                            {watchdog_timer, 15000},
  124:                                            {transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  125:                                            {transport_config, [{ip,    ?ADDR},
  126:                                                                {port,  0},
  127:                                                                {raddr, ?ADDR}]}]}}],
  128:     Collector = flooding_collector_start([SvcName || #{name := SvcName} <-
  129:                                                          Services]),
  130:     flooding_start_and_stop_services(Services),
  131:     flooding_collector_stop(Collector),
  132:     ok.
  133: 
  134: %% -----
  135: 
  136: flooding_start_and_stop_services(Services) ->
  137:     ?P("start start/stop test", []),
  138:     flooding_start_and_stop_services(Services, 100).
  139: 
  140: flooding_start_and_stop_services(_Services, N) when (N =< 0) ->
  141:     ok;
  142: flooding_start_and_stop_services(Services, N) ->
  143:     ?P("start start/stop test (~w remaining)", [N]),
  144:     StartedServices = flooding_start_services(Services, []),
  145:     flooding_stop_services(StartedServices),
  146:     flooding_start_and_stop_services(Services, N-1).
  147: 
  148: flooding_start_services([], StartedServices) ->
  149:     ?P("all services started", []),
  150:     StartedServices;
  151: flooding_start_services([Service|Services], StartedServices) ->
  152:     #{} = Service2 = flooding_start_service(Service, StartedServices),
  153:     flooding_start_services(Services, [Service2|StartedServices]).
  154: 
  155: flooding_start_service(#{type         := server,
  156:                          name         := SvcName,
  157:                          service_opts := SvcOpts,
  158:                          transport    := #{prot      := tcp,
  159:                                            operation := listen,
  160:                                            opts      := TOpts} = T} = S, _) ->
  161:     F = fun() ->
  162:                 ?P("(try) start (server) service ~p", [SvcName]),
  163:                 ok       = diameter:start_service(SvcName, SvcOpts),
  164:                 ?P("(try) start and add (listen) transport for service ~p",
  165:                    [SvcName]),
  166:                 LRef     = ?util:listen(SvcName, tcp, TOpts),
  167:                 [PortNr] = ?util:lport(tcp, LRef),
  168:                 ?P("transport listen port: ~w", [PortNr]),
  169:                 T2 = T#{operation => {listen, PortNr}},
  170:                 exit(S#{transport => T2})
  171:         end,
  172:     {Pid, MRef} = erlang:spawn_monitor(F),
  173:     receive
  174:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Info} when is_map(Info) ->
  175:             ?P("server service started"),
  176:             Info;
  177:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Info} ->
  178:             ?P("server service start failed: "
  179:                "~n   ~p", [Info]),
  180:             exit(server_start_failed)
  181:     end;
  182: flooding_start_service(#{type         := client,
  183:                          name         := SvcName,
  184:                          service_opts := SvcOpts,
  185:                          transport    := #{prot      := tcp,
  186:                                            operation := connect,
  187:                                            opts      := TOpts}} = S,
  188:                        StartedServices) ->
  189:     F = fun() ->
  190:                 ?P("(try) start (client) service ~p", [SvcName]),
  191:                 ok       = diameter:start_service(SvcName, SvcOpts),
  192:                 ?P("(try) start and add transport for service ~p", [SvcName]),
  193:                 {ok, PortNr} =
  194:                     flooding_start_service_listen_portno(StartedServices),
  195:                 {value, {transport_config, TConf}} =
  196:                     lists:keysearch(transport_config, 1, TOpts),
  197:                 TConf2 = [{rport, PortNr} | TConf],
  198:                 TOpts2 = lists:keyreplace(transport_config, 1, TOpts,
  199:                                           {transport_config, TConf2}),
  200:                 ?P("(try) start and add transport for service ~p", [SvcName]),
  201:                 {ok, _Ref} = diameter:add_transport(SvcName, {connect, TOpts2}),
  202:                 exit(S)
  203:         end,
  204:     {Pid, MRef} = erlang:spawn_monitor(F),
  205:     receive
  206:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Info} when is_map(Info) ->
  207:             ?P("client service started"),
  208:             Info;
  209:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Info} ->
  210:             ?P("client service start failed: "
  211:                "~n   ~p", [Info]),
  212:             exit(client_start_failed)
  213:     end.    
  214: 
  215: 
  216: flooding_start_service_listen_portno([]) ->
  217:     {error, not_found};
  218: flooding_start_service_listen_portno(
  219:   [#{type      := server,
  220:      transport := #{operation := {listen, PortNr}}} | _]) ->
  221:     {ok, PortNr};
  222: flooding_start_service_listen_portno([_|StartedServices]) ->
  223:     flooding_start_service_listen_portno(StartedServices).
  224: 
  225: 
  226: flooding_stop_services([]) ->
  227:     ?P("all services stopped", []),
  228:     ok;
  229: flooding_stop_services([#{name := SvcName}|Services]) ->
  230:     ?P("(try) stop service ~p", [SvcName]),
  231:     ok = diameter:stop_service(SvcName),
  232:     flooding_stop_services(Services).
  233: 
  234: 
  235: %% -----
  236: 
  237: flooding_collector_start(Services) ->
  238:     Parent = self(),
  239:     spawn_link(fun() -> flooding_collector_init(Parent, Services) end).
  240: 
  241: flooding_collector_stop(Pid) ->
  242:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  243:     Pid ! {stop, self()},
  244:     receive
  245:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, _} ->
  246:             ok
  247:     end.
  248: 
  249: flooding_collector_init(Parent, Services) ->
  250:     lists:foreach(fun(SvcName) -> diameter:subscribe(SvcName) end, Services),
  251:     flooding_collector_loop(Parent, [{SvcName, []} || SvcName <- Services]).
  252: 
  253: flooding_collector_loop(Parent, Services) ->
  254:     receive
  255:         {stop, Parent} ->
  256:             %% We do not need to unsubscribe
  257:             %% Diameter handles this automatically
  258:             %% Also, this means the test is done anyway...
  259:             ?P("stop command from parent when service event counts are: "
  260:                "~n   ~p", [Services]),
  261:             exit(normal);
  262: 
  263:         #diameter_event{service = Name, info = Event} ->
  264:             case lists:keysearch(Name, 1, Services) of
  265:                 {value, {Name, EvInfo}} ->
  266:                     Ev = flooding_which_event(Event),
  267:                     case lists:keysearch(Ev, 1, EvInfo) of
  268:                         {value, {Ev, Cnt}} ->
  269:                             NewCnt = Cnt+1,
  270:                             ?P("received '~p' event ~w from known service ~p",
  271:                                [Ev, NewCnt, Name]),
  272:                             EvInfo2   = lists:keyreplace(Ev, 1, EvInfo,
  273:                                                          {Ev, NewCnt}),
  274:                             Services2 = lists:keyreplace(Name, 1, Services,
  275:                                                          {Name, EvInfo2}),
  276:                             flooding_collector_loop(Parent, Services2);
  277:                         false ->
  278:                             ?P("received first '~p' event from known service ~p",
  279:                                [Ev, Name]),
  280:                             EvInfo2   = [{Ev, 1}|EvInfo],
  281:                             Services2 = lists:keyreplace(Name, 1, Services,
  282:                                                          {Name, EvInfo2}),
  283:                             flooding_collector_loop(Parent, Services2)
  284:                     end;
  285:                 false ->
  286:                     ?P("received ~p event from UNKNOWN service ~p",
  287:                        [Event, Name]),
  288:                     flooding_collector_loop(Parent, Services)
  289:             end
  290:     end.
  291: 
  292: flooding_which_event(Event) when is_atom(Event) ->
  293:     Event;
  294: flooding_which_event({closed = Event, _, _, _}) ->
  295:     Event;
  296: flooding_which_event({up = Event, _, _, _, _}) ->
  297:     Event;
  298: flooding_which_event({down = Event, _, _, _}) ->
  299:     Event;
  300: flooding_which_event({watchdog, _, _, {initial, okay}, _}) ->
  301:     wd_init_okay;
  302: flooding_which_event({watchdog, _, _, {initial, reopen}, _}) ->
  303:     wd_init_reopen;
  304: flooding_which_event({watchdog, _, _, {okay, down}, _}) ->
  305:     wd_okay_down;
  306: flooding_which_event({watchdog, _, _, {From, To}, _}) ->
  307:     ?P("Unknown watchdog event: "
  308:        "~n   From: ~p"
  309:        "~n   To:   ~p", [From, To]),
  310:     wd;
  311: flooding_which_event({reconnect = Event, _, _}) ->
  312:     Event;
  313: flooding_which_event(Event) when is_tuple(Event) ->
  314:     ?P("Unknown event: "
  315:        "~n   ~p", [Event]),
  316:     element(1, Event);
  317: flooding_which_event(Unknown) ->
  318:     ?P("Unknown event: "
  319:        "~n   ~p", [Unknown]),
  320:     exit({tuple_size, size(Unknown)}).
  321: 
  322: 
  323: 
  324: %% ===========================================================================
  325: 
  326: %% run/0
  327: 
  328: run() ->
  329:     ok = diameter:start(),
  330:     try
  331:         ?util:run([{fun traffic/0, 60000}])
  332:     after
  333:         ok = diameter:stop()
  334:     end.
  335: 
  336: %% traffic/0
  337: 
  338: traffic() ->
  339:     PortNr = start_server(),
  340:     Config = [{portnr, PortNr}],
  341:     Funs = [up, down, cea_timeout],
  342:     ?util:run([[{?MODULE, F, [[{name, F} | Config]]} || F <- Funs]]).
  343: 
  344: %% start_server/0
  345: 
  346: start_server() ->
  347:     diameter:subscribe(?SERVER),
  348:     ok = diameter:start_service(?SERVER, ?SERVICE(?SERVER, [?DICT_COMMON])),
  349:     LRef = ?util:listen(?SERVER, tcp, [{capabilities_cb, fun capx_cb/2},
  350:                                        {capx_timeout, ?SERVER_CAPX_TMO}]),
  351:     [PortNr] = ?util:lport(tcp, LRef),
  352:     start = event(?SERVER),
  353:     PortNr.
  354: 
  355: %% Connect with matching capabilities and expect the connection to
  356: %% come up.
  357: up(Config) ->
  358:     {Svc, Ref, T} = connect(Config, [{strict_mbit, false},
  359:                                      {connect_timer, 5000},
  360:                                      {watchdog_timer, 15000}]),
  361:     start = event(Svc),
  362:     {{up, Ref, {TPid, Caps}, T, #diameter_packet{msg = M}}, _}
  363:         = {event(Svc), T},
  364:     ['CEA' | #{}] = M,  %% assert
  365:     {watchdog, Ref, _, {initial, okay}, _} = event(Svc),
  366:     %% Kill the transport process and see that the connection is
  367:     %% reestablished after a watchdog timeout, not after connect_timer
  368:     %% expiry.
  369:     exit(TPid, kill),
  370:     {{down, Ref, {TPid, Caps}, T}, _} = {event(Svc), T},
  371:     {watchdog, Ref, _, {okay, down}, _} = event(Svc),
  372:     {reconnect, Ref, _} = event(Svc, 10000, 20000).
  373: 
  374: %% Connect with non-matching capabilities and expect CEA from the peer
  375: %% to indicate as much and then for the transport to be restarted
  376: %% (after connect_timer).
  377: down(Config) ->
  378:     {Svc, Ref, T} = connect(Config, [{capabilities, [{'Acct-Application-Id',
  379:                                                       [?DICT_ACCT:id()]}]},
  380:                                      {applications, [?DICT_ACCT]},
  381:                                      {connect_timer, 5000},
  382:                                      {watchdog_timer, 20000}]),
  383:     start = event(Svc),
  384:     {{closed, Ref, {'CEA', ?NO_COMMON_APP, _, #diameter_packet{msg = M}}, T},
  385:      _}
  386:         = {event(Svc), T},
  387:     ['CEA' | #{}] = M,  %% assert
  388:     {reconnect, Ref, _} = event(Svc, 4000, 10000).
  389: 
  390: %% Connect with matching capabilities but have the server delay its
  391: %% CEA and cause the client to timeout.
  392: cea_timeout(Config) ->
  393:     {Svc, Ref, T} = connect(Config, [{capx_timeout, ?SERVER_CAPX_TMO div 2},
  394:                                      {connect_timer, 2*?SERVER_CAPX_TMO}]),
  395:     start = event(Svc),
  396:     {{closed, Ref, {'CEA', timeout}, T}, _} = {event(Svc), T}.
  397: 
  398: %% ----------------------------------------
  399: 
  400: %% Keep the server from sending CEA until the client has timed out.
  401: capx_cb(_, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {_, "cea_timeout-" ++ _}}) ->
  402:     receive after ?SERVER_CAPX_TMO -> ok end;
  403: 
  404: %% Or not.
  405: capx_cb(_, _Caps) ->
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: %% ----------------------------------------
  409: 
  410: %% Use the testcase name to construct Origin-Host of the client so
  411: %% that the server can match on it in capx_cb/2.
  412: connect(Config, Opts) ->
  413:     Pre = atom_to_list(proplists:get_value(name, Config)),
  414:     Name = Pre ++ uniq() ++ ?CLIENT,
  415:     diameter:subscribe(Name),
  416:     ok = start_service(Name, ?SERVICE(Name, [?DICT_COMMON, ?DICT_ACCT])),
  417:     {connect, _} = T = opts(Config, Opts),
  418:     {ok, Ref} = diameter:add_transport(Name, T),
  419:     {Name, Ref, T}.
  420: 
  421: uniq() ->
  422:     "-" ++ diameter_util:unique_string().
  423: 
  424: event(Name) ->
  425:     receive #diameter_event{service = Name, info = T} -> T end.
  426: 
  427: event(Name, TL, TH) ->
  428:     T0 = diameter_lib:now(),
  429:     Event = event(Name),
  430:     DT = diameter_lib:micro_diff(T0) div 1000,
  431:     {true, true, DT, Event} = {TL < DT, DT < TH, DT, Event},
  432:     Event.
  433: 
  434: start_service(Name, Opts) ->
  435:     diameter:start_service(Name, [{monitor, self()} | Opts]).
  436: 
  437: opts(Config, Opts) ->
  438:     PortNr = proplists:get_value(portnr, Config),
  439: 
  440:     {connect, [{transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  441:                {transport_config, [{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0},
  442:                                    {raddr, ?ADDR}, {rport, PortNr}]}
  443:                | Opts]}.
  444: 
  445: realm(Host) ->
  446:     tl(lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C /= $. end, Host)).
